Big mistake, because apparently if your health is at 3 or 4 ticks, you start to bleed out. Honestly, I saw someone write a 'review' and they didn't explain anything, just said it was awful, but 'good for a free game.' Hearing this simply made me curious. Why did he say that everything was awful but good for a free game? So, I decided to play and actually take notes. Well, I played about an hour of it, and then I quit. Here's a list of the problems I found with the game.
1): Missing textures. If I'm downloading your game, please provide all the textures. It really removes from the atmosphere when I have missing texture here and there.
2): Controls. They're not bad, but I was stuck in the beginning because ‚ÄòF‚Äô was the Use key, instead of the traditional ‚ÄòE‚Äô key. I know that‚Äôs not really a problem, but an explanation would have been nice. Sure, it did tell you, after you left the room, which requires you to figure it out first. Little late, thanks. While we‚Äôre on controls, the car was absolutely terrible. I flipped the car on accident, and the brake is so horribly done. Could use for some fixing.  Plus, there‚Äôs no need to go /that/ fast in this game.
3): Achievements: I got the Slenderman Achievement, and I don‚Äôt even know how. This could just be me, but I looked at a gramophone and hit F, and got it. Did I miss Slenderman, or what?
4): Stephano was in it. Clearly this is directed at PewDiePie, but I saw a ‚Äòcollected 1/3‚Äô pop up, and even though I‚Äôm not a fan, I‚Äôm also not against him in any way, but I don‚Äôt want to have PewDiePie literally shoved into my face when I‚Äôm playing a game. Maybe have it in game, but don‚Äôt make it a side mission or anything.
5): Invisible boarders. You had a perfectly fine set up with the entire area surrounded in a log fence, but people can get over those and walk into an invisible wall, which is terrible. Simple put the invisible wall where the log fences are, and then I wouldn‚Äôt have gotten my car stuck on the fence.
6): Animations could use some work. Swimming animation looks really awkward, there‚Äôs no animation when you‚Äôre driving outside of the tires moving. I.E. Character doesn‚Äôt turn the steering wheel, or react at all.
7): There were several areas where lights were being emitted with no source.
8): More than half of the notes didn‚Äôt have voice acting while some did. This is just odd, either do voice acting for all of them, or none.
9): Monsters did not feel threatening at all. They shook around when they ran towards you or stood still like they were from Cry of Fear or something. This was far more annoying than threatening or scary. Speaking of monsters, confronting them was ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•t. If two of them got close enough to you, you‚Äôre more than likely dead. This doesn‚Äôt make them threatening, this makes them annoying.
10): There were grammar issues, but I don‚Äôt really care that much.
11): The Bolt cutters worked weird. Cut the chain, and the basement doors broke‚Ä¶ What?
12): When loading for the next stage there‚Äôs a chance of running into a bug. You‚Äôre ported to the other side of the door, and once in a while the game just sticks you there, and forgets to load, leaving you stuck.
13): So many unnecessary transitions between rooms. The maps not loading anything new, it‚Äôs just porting me to the other side of the door.  Opening the door would have been easier.
14): Unrealistic use for TNT. You DO NOT use TNT just to open a freaking door made of four to five planks of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• wood! I had a sledge hammer that could have easily broken the door, and yet I wasted TNT to blow it up. Why?! I could have saved that and used it for something more constructive, creative, or useful! Absolutely terrible, not to mention, I wrote nearly half of that before the TNT exploded. It took forever to go off.
15): There were way too many loading screens. I felt like I was waiting more than I was playing.
16): Why was there multiple choice answers/questions? From what I saw nothing was changing up, and it kept going back until I clicked all of them. A cut scene, sure that works, but having me click the questions/answers until all were done was pointless and time wasting.
I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs a lot more, but honestly, there was just so much terrible crap going on that I just couldn‚Äôt keep playing, wasn‚Äôt worth the hardware space. Not worth it, not even if it‚Äôs free.

reviewText:
I was recommended to play this by Steam and as it was a Horror and Free to Play I decided to check it out. As it was Free to Play, I went into it with the mindset that it may not be too good. Therefore, I am going to explain what I thought of it below and if it is worth playing in my opinion.

Gameplay:

Pros:

‚ô¶ Playable
‚ô¶ Realistic Running Energy (Can only run for x amount of time before having to regenerate)
‚ô¶ Good number of weapons to find and use (This keeps the game interesting)
‚ô¶ Decent length for what the game is (Can take a long time if you keep dying due to the poor enemy spawn locations, the difficultness to kill them and the limited save locations)

Cons:

‚ô¶ The story was very hard to follow and unclear
‚ô¶ The notes seemed to be randomly placed and make no sense as to why they are placed where they are
‚ô¶ Walking on some areas, objects and items causes you to lose gravity and get stuck to the roof making your character move really slow (Jumping a lot fixes this, but is annoying in the first place)
‚ô¶ Jump Scares were non-existent (There were some but really ‚ÄúChanging Screen Colour and shaking it randomly isn‚Äôt scary)
‚ô¶ The ‚ÄúTNT‚Äù was glitched (You had to collect 3 pieces located in the dungeon, however if you loaded a save, went through a door where it loaded and you came back, you could pick up the first piece again and it would say you had 2/3 pieces. This was in fact not the case as you only still had 1 piece as you hadn‚Äôt found and collected the other pieces located in the dungeon)
‚ô¶ Enemies randomly spawn in the most annoying places (They randomly spawn to try and scare you, which is good‚Ä¶ Although, they spawn in places you can‚Äôt really escape from easily. This is annoying as it takes a high amount of ammo to kill one enemy and if two or more have spawned near you, it‚Äôs really hard to survive. Along with this, if an enemy hits you, your screen shakes making it almost impossible to get an accurate hit on them and it takes them a lot less hits to kill you than it does you to kill them)
‚ô¶ Enemies easily kill you where it takes you a long time to kill them
‚ô¶ If an enemy has attacked you, sometimes (Not sure if everytime), you‚Äôll start to bleed (This is bad as you‚Äôve probably used your health kit in the fight already and then just walk around bleeding and most likely will die)
‚ô¶ Saves are few and far between (Due to the hardness of actually killing an enemy and the easiness of them killing you, this is terrible. You‚Äôll spend a long time walking round finding things and doing the puzzles only to die and end half an hour back and have to redo everything only to hope not to die again)
‚ô¶ Only allowed one health kit at a time (This is annoying as if you have been saving up health and see another kit, you can‚Äôt make use of it)
‚ô¶ Repetitive (I mentioned decent length, but due to dying a lot and few save locations, you will have to repeat yourself over and over again)
‚ô¶ At times it‚Äôs hard to know what to do (But it‚Äôs pretty easy to figure out if you just search around and use your inventory items, but there should be more story as to what you‚Äôre doing and why you‚Äôre doing it, some things just don‚Äôt make sense)
‚ô¶ 0% Scariness (No real jump scares or horror scenes)

Graphics:
Pros:

‚ô¶ Horror like
‚ô¶ Graphics seem high quality for a F2P game
‚ô¶ Decent menu graphics settings

Cons:

‚ô¶ When the Screen Changes colour and shakes to try and scare you (It just looks as though they inverted some colours and is really dodgy)
‚ô¶ Lighting can be fairly dark even with the light sources given such as the torch
‚ô¶ Menu and in-game notes text can be hard to read (This is due to the font style chosen to try and make it look scary. Though it‚Äôs more annoying than scary as the notes have to be read to even begin to try and understand the storyline)
Sound:
Pros:

‚ô¶ Has volume sliders and speaker setting options (This is excellent to control the volume and how you want to hear it)
‚ô¶ Sounds seem fitting for a horror
Cons:

‚ô¶ By default the music is louder than the voice acting in cinematics and when the character reads notes (This makes you miss key parts of the story which cannot be replayed)
‚ô¶ Voice acting seems limited when it comes to reading found notes (This is weird as only some chosen notes are read aloud whereas others you have to read yourself)
Achievements:

Pros:

‚ô¶ Decent amount that are gotten throughout the game (Not all at one point or by grinding certain things)
‚ô¶ 11 out of 13 are easy to get (Most are gotten by just playing and exploring the game, not grinding things like in other games)
‚ô¶Achievement for collecting statues without dying, loading or saving (This is only for the pro gamers and can be very difficult, however it gives the game an edge to it for those who found it good enough to replay it)
‚ô¶ When completed achievements get a tick on them (That‚Äôs a nifty addition in my opinion)

Cons:

‚ô¶ There is an achievement for picking up a weapon (However, to get this you have to have donated or finished the game. This makes no sense as the weapon should only appear if the game has been finished or if you have donated, not on the first play through)
‚ô¶ There is an achievement related to ‚ÄúFinding Slender‚Äù (This is terrible as the game has nothing to do with Slenderman)
‚ô¶ Random achievement for collecting statues (No idea why we are collecting statues of a random person)

Price:

Pros

‚ô¶ Free with no micro-transactions

Cons:

‚ô¶ Can‚Äôt expect much due to being free
‚ô¶ Tries to get you to donate for an achievement (Shouldn‚Äôt be asking for donations, if people want to donate they will)

Other:

Pros:

‚ô¶ Keyboard controls just work and are easily mapped (Despite F being interact/use by default when most other games use E)

Cons:
‚ô¶ The random Screen Shake and Colour Change seems to be a Slenderman rip-off but nothing appears
‚ô¶ Some Loading Screen tips seem to be worded incorrectly (Said to ‚ÄúSpend your ammunition wisely‚Äù when it should have says Use as ammunition isn‚Äôt a currency)
‚ô¶ At one point you see a Slenderman like figure in a window (This is weird as this game has nothing to do with Slenderman)
‚ô¶ Uses the Swastika on the save/load menu screen randomly as though it‚Äôs a cool thing to include
‚ô¶ No restore to default when changing keyboard controls (This is annoying if you want to change them back)


Overall, the game is free to play and runs well. However, I wouldn‚Äôt really recommended this unless you are playing games for a sense of achievement and beating all the games on Steam as there is no actual scariness or things that make a horror good in this game and the storyline makes absolutely minimal sense. Though, I have finished this and for a free game I‚Äôd recommend you install it (If you have a spare 7gb) to try it out and determine if you like it for yourself. However, with that said, I personally think the cons out way the pros and wouldn‚Äôt play this again myself as it is annoying with few save slots, how easy it is for the enemies to kill you and how hard it is for you to kill them, the poor spawn locations for the enemies, the glitchy stuck to the roof thing, the poor horror events and the extremely hard to follow storyline just doesn‚Äôt make me want to play this or recommend it to anyone.

You take the role of Grobuskna, a detective, who knows who killed his parents. He just does not know where the killer is hiding. Until an unknown call reaches Grobuskna's office, thats where the game begins.
Gameplay is about collecting items to proceed and shooting your way through strange looking enemies. It takes around 4 hours to finish the game.
The story is not much interesting, which is also a result of the bad voice acting.
The graphic are also not the best, but still ok for a free game.
You just run through the game to finish it and thats it, no replay value at all.
The Forgotten Ones is not scary and not interesting, the only good aspect is that you can play it for free.
My advice, take a look at Cry of Fear, it is also free and it delivers a good horror atmosphere.

Sounds 3/10
Graphics 5/10
Gameplay 4/10
Atmosphere 3/10

reviewText:
The Forgotten Ones is a Half Life 2 horror mod available for free.

It‚Äôs also a pretty bad game. Despite the story‚Äôs premise being interesting it‚Äôs not developed in any meaningful way, the only reminders of a story even existing in the first place being missable notes barely saying anything scattered across the game.

The typical atmosphere a horror game worthy of that name should possess is completely absent. Even the cat scares are horribly executed and will leave you wondering what just happened. The only scary thing in the game are the monsters, not because of they way they look or sound or anything like that, but simply because even the weakest creatures are unstoppable juggernauts of doom for about 3/4 of the game. They hit like trains, slowing down the player and leaving their aim wobbling all over the place, while shrugging off the completely inadequate gunfire.

There is pretty much a single effective way to deal with enemies in this game: jumping over a crate and fooling the monsters‚Äô pathfinding so they can either be sniped (while they keep moving frantically) or beaten up with whatever melee weapon is available if they decide to actually get near the vantage point, all in complete safety. Solitary enemies can also be kited around but that‚Äôs not a surefire way and only works with melee weapons as the firearms are all either too slow or too weak in what‚Äôs probably the least satisfying gunplay I‚Äôve ever seen in a videogame.

There‚Äôs also plenty of bugs, ranging from the chuckle worthy (as if the atmosphere needed to be ruined any further) to the annoying (maps refusing to load, forcing you to go back to your last save) to the game breaking (a map refusing to load no matter what, even after reloading, which forced me to go back to a previous save).

Last, the developer decided to stuff the game with very obvious easter eggs referencing to their favorite youtubers. In a horror game. For some reason.

In the end the only reason I‚Äôd recommend playing this game is if you want to indulge in the morbid curiosity towards disaster that makes human beings flock to train wrecks to take pictures with their cellphones.

reviewText:
The Forgotten Ones is an interesting enough game for fans of the Horror genre. While it falls short of many other small independantly developed games, in the same genre. (Cry of Fear comes to mind, when I think of small, independently developed Horror games. That I hold to high standards.)

It's still a worthwhile title to check out, and waste a few hours playing. Despite many of the negative reviews this title has recieved. I feel that the game is getting a much worse rap than it in all honesty, deserves.
Finishing the game, and getting all of the achievements. I've say I'd have my fair share of the game, to give it a reccomendation.

However, this game is indeed for the niche crowd that does not mind playing with the games mechanics in order to survive.
In short, abusing exlpoits in the games engine in order to complete the game.
Now you may be able to get through the game without resorting to abusing the enemy AI, I for one, found it all but neccesary.

Pros:

+Good atmosphere, has a very unsetlling setting in some areas in particular.

+Decent ambient soundtrack and noises, although some can get pretty repetitive when they loop infinitly.

+Varied weapons, and they all feel and sound powerful.

+No Crosshairs, you must use the iron sights if you wish to hit an enemy accurately, and the iron sights are well done.

+Scarce ammo and health pickups, you can only carry one spare medkit at a time, you can only save at certain locations. It really hit homes the survival horror vibe it's going for.

+I really dig the puzzle elements and inventory management system that is included with the game. Though the puzzles are not the hardest. They more than enough suffice for such a small dev team on this game.


Cons

-First and foremost, the enemies are incredibly hard to survive unless you abuse the enemy AI. (i.e. Jumping ontop of a high placed object, just out of reach of an enemy's attack.)
They require lots of ammo to put down, unless you consistantly place headshots. They are very fast, and worse of all, their attacks will stun lock you, making you move to a snails crawl and most certainly will spell your doom, if you get backed into a corner.

-There are several bugs that are common I have experienced. Getting stuck in place after loading an area, requires you go back through the door and back again to move, or in worst case's, a full restart from last save.
Constantly getting stuck on objects, where you have to pick them up and throw them in able to move.

reviewText:
This game wants to be a horror title, that shows insights to the horrors of WWII, while also realistically portraying the human desire for revenge. It manages to do none of those.

One of the main things I noticed is that the team put so little attention to detail that many of the props with no bottom texture like the filing cabinets (and at one point a dresser) are see-through on the bottom. That's the scariest part of this game: How little attention the developers put into making this a pleasant experience.

The controls are clunky, ambushes are cheap, enemies have about three frames of animation each, and the voice acting is so fakely German that as someone of Austrian descent I'm kind of offended. Have you considered hiring actual English-speaking Germans? That'd go a long way towards fixing it.

Also the jumpscares are laughable at best. Monsters cheaply ambush you, but I reacted with anger at how unbelievably cliche it was, not with fear.

The notes are unbelievably dumb, there were enough typos I almost thought it was translated by a first year immigrant. At one point they spelled 'despair' as 'dispair' on one of the notes in the illogical maze known as the mansion.

Also for the graphics I could forgive someone for thinking this was a Playstation 1 game, the weapons feel so clunky that it makes me want to go play Half-Life 2 instead, or if not the classics, maybe an actually good source mod. If you're looking for something fun, this is not it. I was nothing but frustrated the entire time.

I will give you five points for effort though, because clearly it took you 'some' time to do this.

_______________________-
*SPOILERS*

If you want me to run down the plot of this game, here it is:

You are a Jewsish detective living in the small town of Nonsensical-Invisiblewallistan in the middle of a country where everyone speaks in poor fake german accents.

After doing the amazingly complex task of picking up food for a character that has the same amount of depth of character as the paper bag the food you deliver to him is in. In this police station, time and space are ripping a hole, and the filing cabinets are missing the bottom.

Due to advanced facial recognition technology, your character is trapped within a 10 meter radius of the police station. After this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•t, you then proceed to drive into lame-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• forest, whose name is so cliche it sends shivers down your spine. Your character, apparently sensing the player's presence, begins to monologue, because he falsely assumes that you give a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, unlike everyone else. The plot twist is that the player doesn't care either.

You then come across a trick laid out for you by the devil, a log that if you attempt to drive up to will cause your car to freeze in time and space. Luckily, you only needed to drive about a three minute walk, so you're fine anyway. After checking in to the bathroom stalls that are present infront of a mysterious hotel that also has bathrooms in each individual room, you have the opportunity to pick up a scoped weapon which you will never use.

When you go up to the hotel you notice it is locked, but that's okay, because a character so idiotic I forgot his name the second I stopped hearing it thought to have the key to the hotel in his house (Which is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•t because said plot-advancing 2D character is already inside the hotel, meaning he locked himself inside(?), or somehow broke out, put the key back into his shed specifically for your arrival (Which he detected with his psychic powers) and broke back in. His psychic powers stop functioning in your presence, however, because he dies less than a minute later. I'm kind of glad because the sound of his voice almost made me suicidal.

Your parents died and you want revenge.

Don't play this, it's awful.

reviewText:
The Forgotten Ones is a Half-Life 2 Mod designed to tell a story of madness and vengeance. I suppose I should start off by saying I'm most certainly not one for the horror/scary game style, but after a year of keeping this game in the corner of my mind, I finally broke down and tried it out. The Forgotten Ones introduces you to several ideas I actually wish more games would embrace and more developers would try. Instead of rehashed characters/sprites from the Half-Life 2 library, The Forgotten Ones actually attempts originality with creatures and does not bog you down with constant enemy spawn points. While the many grunt enemies require a gratuitous amount or well placed bullets to silence, the several bosses that are strewn amid the chaotic mansion require critical and quick thinking to overcome. Puzzles, although mostly simple find item/use item style, are distanced from each other rather well; however, the enemies you will encounter between puzzles are the real test.

The Forgotten Ones does have its issues: The enemy AI humorously falters here and there, items do not always want to be picked up, there are save locations instead of quick or even checkpoint saving, and one or two places where you may no-clip through a wall or object and get stuck. Even with all those issues, The Forgotten Ones is an interesting take on the horror genre for gaming utilizing good ideas for cover and trapping enemies to conserve ammunition, a very solid mix of music and terrifying sounds that will keep you checking behind your computer chair, and a satisfying duration.

I most certainly hope you consider trying out The Forgotten Ones, its an exciting, a little rough around the edges, horror First Person Shooter with some serious attention and care in its execution.

reviewText:
While it isn't the most impressive mod I've seen, The Forgetten Ones isn't as horrible as people want to make it out to be. The story was creative, albeit cheesy. Still, it was a fun ghoulish ride while it lasted. The controls are fine and the game functions as it should. No crashes or anything. The sound design is of average quality, it isn't bad, but it isn't great ethier.  Its just mainly stock effects from the Source Engine. Nothing really unusual.

The voice acting is a hit and miss in certain spots, the accents can sometimes be way too thick and hard to understand. Then theres also times where it feels like the voices don't have much emotion to them. The level design is average, it isn't as creative as it could've been, but it does the job.

The combat however is where the mod is very flawed, it feels as though you're forced to fight every single enemy you come across. And most of the enemies are WAY too fast to shake off. It espically gets annoying when you get hit, your screen bounces around the place. You can't hit anything when this happens and you'll be dead in seconds.

Overall, The Forgotten Ones is a good mod for what it is, but needs some serious tune ups. I like the developer's creativity and certainly eager to see what he will do next. Hopefully he will make note of what was wrong in this mod and improve upon it in the next project.

reviewText:
So I'll admit flat out that I knew this would be bad. That's partly why I played it in the first place since I have a side project going that someone asked for where I do MST3K style riffing on bad games (albeit more mean spirited as it often turns out to be, but they generally deserve it). This was going to be one such game.  I also chose it because the person behind it was responsible for a horrific coop mod for another very neat mod named Black Snow. This not only missed the point of Black Snow but was also badly mangled both in localization and bugginess. It pretty much ruined the experience for first time players by them thinking it was an official project.

You could say that my attitude coming into it was not exactly positive. I don't deny that. But this piece of trash was disgusting in a way I never could have imagined. This isn't just hyperbole, it literally is disgusting. Why it's disgusting is evident about 10 seconds into the video below (which is only part 1 of 6 of the series and it gets steadily worse in each one). But to put it bluntly: This piece of trash and the other piece of trash who created it reuses WWII mass grave and concentration camp footage, inserts its own characters as part of that footage and then proceeds to treat everything surrounding it about as seriously as people treat the Black Eyed Peas. And yes my choice of analogy there was intentional.

But even if we are to ignore that bit of tastelessness the game is a train wreck. It tries hard to mimic Cry of Fear. So hard that it went so far as to (badly) emulate the black screens that occurred during cell transitions found both there and in older games. Now in said older games this was necessary due to technical limitations like memory size and clock speed before either could deal with aggressive culling algos. The transitions were questionable even for Cry of Fear but at least there it could be attributed to it being a modified GoldSrc. But Source could do these maps without issue. There were much larger maps in HL2 itself than this. So pointless at best and really annoying padding at worst.

The monsters are unbalanced. I see what they were trying to do here too but they failed at it. If you're going to make it 90s survival horror style then add combat mechanics and weapons that are worth a damn. Failing that, actually give people a way to run like you could in aforementioned survival horror games instead of just telling them to do it in the loading screen. Another favored tactic of this game is to either put invisible walls all over the place (a mark of great design right?) or in at least one case spawn monsters and put a literal wall. Or otherwise spawn the monsters such that you get cornered. Prepare for a lot of crouch jumping onto obstacles if you want the slightest chance of winning a fight.

Then there is asset reuse aplenty all over the place. Not just the HL2 assets but stuff that I'm almost certain hasn't actually been licensed. Again.  See Black Eyed Peas reference. Yes there is a certain well known Black Eyed Peas track in this piece of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• that dares to use mass grave and camp footage to force drama.

What I missed in the video is summarized in the comments by Benjamoose pretty well. Anything else  I missed in the review (I tried to get it all, I hate looking like I'm advertising videos in this stuff) will probably appear in the rest of the series currently being uploaded.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NgT96LRNGjw&list=UU9jU7PlxiRNS1JfdUAlQxcA

and yes there are 5 of those little statues from Amnesia (models which I'm sure are used with permission) that are apparently a certain bad letsplayer's fantasy sex toy to collect. Didn't really feel it was worth going in depth for since it's already been hammered into the ground. It's just another drop in a sea of stupid developers trying to bait these people to get free publicity. Probably not going to work for this one.

Optimization is a thing I can get past. I don't care how my games run, unless it's a fast-paced FPS like TF2, or anything fast-paced for that matter. 15-20 frames is fine with me.

reviewText:
Let me get this straight, you want me to tell you a review about this game? Whoever you are, you might as well go to the curators, because if you've come for a review on this game, you've come to the wrong place. However, if you have come for an outstanding chocolate chip cookie recipe, you've come to the right place.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ingredients
1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter
3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar
3/4 cup sugar
2 large eggs
1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips, or chunks
2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon fine salt

Directions
1. Evenly position 2 racks in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. (on convection setting if you have it.) Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone sheets. (If you only have 1 baking sheet, let it cool completely between batches.)

2. Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl, cover and microwave on medium power until melted. (Alternatively melt in a small saucepan.) Cool slightly. Whisk the sugars, eggs, butter and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth.

3. Whisk the flour, baking soda and salt in another bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients with a wooden spoon; take care not to over mix. Stir in the chocolate chips or chunks.

4. Scoop heaping tablespoons of the dough onto the prepared pans. Wet hands slightly and roll the dough into balls. Space the cookies about 2-inches apart on the pans. Bake, until golden, but still soft in the center, 12 to 16 minutes, depending on how chewy or crunchy you like your cookies. Transfer hot cookies with a spatula to a rack to cool. Serve.

5. Store cookies in a tightly sealed container for up to 5 days.

For a Rocky Road Bar:
1. Lightly butter a 9 by 13-inch baking pan. Make the batter as per cookie recipe and fold in 1 cup chopped walnuts along with the chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake until the edges are light brown and the batter sets, about 45 minutes. Cool slightly and cover surface with 4 cups marshmallows and 1 cup chocolate chips. Broil at least 8 inches from the heat until marshmallows turn golden brown, about 2 minutes. (Keep an eye on the marshmallows, and turn the pan frequently--they go from golden to char in a wink.) Cool, cut and serve.

And that is that the 'exploring' (sic) side of things, in between picking up things or killing things, unless you are a truly hardened horror-fan (or maybe one of the undead), is the very last thing you will want to be doing as you play the game. You constantly want to be out-of-there, with all this horrible nightmare cleared up by the good guys. But in 'The Forgotten Ones' there is only you..., and some fairly feeble weaponry considering what you will have to face. I don't want to suggest that this turns itself into a gore-blaster, that would spoil the dangerous fear you will experience playing it. I don't generally play horror games, I'm a WWII gamer at heart, it was the story-line that caught my eye and got me to try it out. reviewText:
A great horror mod that you should definitley try out and give it a chance.

This mod captures a true terrifying atmosphere, combining sudden noises to unexpected jumpscares and other creepy elements makes for an unforgetable and terrifying experience! One thing TFO does well which a lot of other mods and games don't manage, is that it makes you reluctant to keep pressing onwards. When you see a dark corridor, you won't want to go there, the fear in this mod is captivated very well.

A lot of people are really complaining too much about this mod. For starters, it is meant to be difficult. A lot of games and mods these days seem to take your hand and walk you through. TFO narrates a good story, and gives you the freedom to explore and look around. You're not supposed to know exactly what to do, you're supposed to find your way and search for clues.
Yes there are references to memes and YouTubers but that's purely for fun and people should stop complaining that these references are in the mod. The monsters are fast and tough, you need to be prepared and fight for your life. So before you slag this mod to pieces, play it, and understand it.

Here's some other good features about TFO:

-There's a great deal of custom and converted stuff, really fun to use weapons, interactive items and notes as well as being able to interact with the environment to search for clues and speculate the mysteries within the mod.
-Very good and familiar soundtrack, some tracks just really suit the atmoshphere of the mod and will give you chills!
-Mystery lies behind every corner, you really have to make the most of your resources and sanity, which further makes for a great horror experience
-Multiple choice weapons, you'll come across different guns and items to take with you, but you'll have to decide carefully which ones will keep you surviving...

Negatives about this mod:

-The monsters can be tough and quick, especially the first few monsters you encounter, you're given a wide variety of weapons to fight them off however. But, these monsters could possibly be slowed down or throw less damage at you.
-Some of the sounds and music don't seem to sound 100% in sync with the rest of the mod, but it's made very good use when it features.
-Weapons could possibly do a little more damage.
-Possibly an extra or more driving opportunities, it's a great feature in the mod that sadly didn't get much use

I highly recommend this mod if you want a great scare and some goosebumps and a pleasant story-telling experience!

reviewText:
Now, this game has some very interesting elements.

It feels very Resident Evil-like, with the ressource management and the realisitc aiming, but it has some VERY big problems that are not just subject to personal taste.

Firstly, the sound engine is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ed.

Sometimes the voice of the character when in cutscenes was overridden completely by the music or the ambient sounds, and seeing as voices apparently intercut with game sounds under options, youve got no other option than to play almost without music if you wish to hear your character, but seeing as the voice acting is incredibly cheesy and amateuristic, that might be for the best.

The combat is also a right ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, not because of the guns mind you, they function well and the aiming is smooth and well animated. But the first enemy i encountered (a incredibly goofy looking two headed zombie) took so many pistol shots that it rivaled on the border of insanity, whereupon i pulled out the rifle and killed him with one shot. Later i was confronted by not one but two of these buggers, in a very small shed no less. No biggie, i thought, they stand no chance against my rifle!

about 3 seconds later i had 2 health bars left because i was stunlocked by continuos attacks.

The game is also VERY much Pewdie-bait as many people have called out already. Within only 4 minutes of playing i found a note whereupon there was a pokemon card with Felix Kjellberg's (Also known as Pewdiepie) face on it. The collectibles taking the form of Felix's erstwhile companion Stephano definitely doesnt help, and only seems to slam down the otherwise great atmosphere this game builds.

But thats enough of the bad, why did i recommend this game?

Well, the works really.

Its one of the best horror games ive played since Amnesia: The Dark Descent, and thats saying a lot. The inclusion of guns into its gameplay at first left me a bit queezy, as i though we were going to be fighting slow moving zombies and the likes. But no, the guns feel old enough to give you a sense of dread even while holding them because they look unreliable.

The graphics theyve gotten out of the source engine are alright, but it's still obvious that they had to make some cuts here and there, and i say that literally.

The ressource management is cool, but the fact that you can only carry a certain amount of health kits is in my opinion a bad choice. The fact that when you reload you dont have a concrete ammo count, but rather a number of magazines, makes it even more hectic, when you dont know whether to reload and waste those last 3 bullets or keep them and maybe have to reload in the middle of a fight.

I've gotta be honest, even if this game cost money i would tell people to get it, because it's certainly better than some *cough* sir you are being hunted *cough* horror games out there.

But alas, it's free, so go ahead and download it and have a good and scary time, i know i have so far.

The current time you see that I have played this reflects the standing of the game. Most of the time, I had to keep on trying to change the settings around to see if that would aid in me playing the game.

The game is formed around the Half Life 2 engine (source engine), which reflects the price of the game, free.... With that being said, the problems with Source have been here for most source based games. This game is no different, the game bugs out whenever the [alt]+[tab] combo is used. And changing the settings around will only make it bug up even more. After changing some of the settings around, it caused the game to freeze. I had to restart the game and it looped through the title sequence for 10 minutes before I was forced to close it down again. The game is unpredictable with the mechanics and it is really clunky. You can get caught on lots of objects, making the game really disastrous. The loading screen is extremely long to the fact that I could use the restroom and still have time left on the loading. For something that is not complex, the title sequence is not doing it justice.

The audio levels are messed up beyond comprehension. You can hear another character on the phone, but then the audio gets quieter when the main character starts to talk back to that individual.

If you die, there is a second or two delay for the death screen to appear. This paired with the fact that the game has no real direction (you are not really informed where to go), hinders the game completely. Subtitles are completely off with the audio at certain points, and the interface with the shop keeper at the beginning is completely unreadable due to the bug.

This is a free version of the SlenderMan : The Arrival, but it mirrors so much of the slender series that once you play Slender, you cannot go back to these types of games. SlenderMan redefined this type of gameplay, but this game completely mocks the genre. They should have spent funds on making their own engine instead of making a free game with the sub-par Source Engine.

reviewText:
The current time you see that I have played this reflects the standing of the game. Most of the time, I had to keep on trying to change the settings around to see if that would aid in me playing the game.

The game is formed around the Half Life 2 engine (source engine), which reflects the price of the game, free.... With that being said, the problems with Source have been here for most source based games. This game is no different, the game bugs out whenever the [alt]+[tab] combo is used. And changing the settings around will only make it bug up even more. After changing some of the settings around, it caused the game to freeze. I had to restart the game and it looped through the title sequence for 10 minutes before I was forced to close it down again. The game is unpredictable with the mechanics and it is really clunky. You can get caught on lots of objects, making the game really disastrous. The loading screen is extremely long to the fact that I could use the restroom and still have time left on the loading. For something that is not complex, the title sequence is not doing it justice.

The audio levels are messed up beyond comprehension. You can hear another character on the phone, but then the audio gets quieter when the main character starts to talk back to that individual.

If you die, there is a second or two delay for the death screen to appear. This paired with the fact that the game has no real direction (you are not really informed where to go), hinders the game completely. Subtitles are completely off with the audio at certain points, and the interface with the shop keeper at the beginning is completely unreadable due to the bug.

This is a free version of the SlenderMan : The Arrival, but it mirrors so much of the slender series that once you play Slender, you cannot go back to these types of games. SlenderMan redefined this type of gameplay, but this game completely mocks the genre. They should have spent funds on making their own engine instead of making a free game with the sub-par Source Engine.

First and forward, I have yet to beat the game yet, just begun- but this is my standpoint so far:

Overall, the game has a dark feel to it, definately a Germany-Nazi timing.  The music is very good for the ambiance and the graphics are outstanding.  The game is a little confusing at start, but once you get the hang of it, the game has me hooked.  There is a small learning curve to how to movement, but easy to catch on.

Pros: 1) Stunning music to go with this type of game.
2) Graphics are outstanding, even it's dark.
3) Movement is easy with a small learning curve.
4) Good storyline so far, excellent job.

Cons: 1) The graphics can be a bit choppy.
2) A little laggy at times, and confusing to where to go.
3) Save places are hard to find at times (might be just part of the game though).

For people who want a good game with a good storyline and re-learn gameplay, this is great.  For those who want a 'run 'n'gun' game, this is not the best for you unless you want to move to something different.  I love the game so far, and am really glad Greenlight gave it a go.  I hope that more people will give this game a try, the stunning work involved making it and it hard to step away, even you are just looking at the graphics in the game.  Way to go group- keep up the work!

-Fox


*Edit-
The zombies that come at you are more like cut & paste critters, and they are a lot faster than you could be.  The lack of ammo makes it very difficult to beat them, even with a -few- headshots to them.  I still like the idea, don't get me wrong.  Developers put a lot of work in the feel of the game, it just needs some refining.

-Fox

reviewText: I downloaded this game on a whim, because it's free (of course) and I couldn't be bothered to actually buy something. Off the bat, I was very impressed with the musical score. The graphics are very 2008, but I do like some of the developer's ingenuity. Aside from a few annoying sound effects that overlapped the quiet introduction dialogue, I was rather impressed with the voice acting. Especially for an Indie game! In keeping with the general theme, every character you meet has a rather comical German/Russian blend of an accent. The ambient sound is very impressive, even in the opening office sequence. I really enjoyed hearing the busy bustle of paperwork, doors opening and closing, and muted conversations from parties unknown. Following a (seemingly) pointless optional food run for a co-worker, a strange angle view of my own car driving, and then a short GTA run in the ol' shaggin' wagon, I entered a hotel and promptly encountered a lightning fast enemy. Tracking it eventually upstairs and to a room, I promptly died when my underpowered rifle failed to kill the mutant ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•er that was gutting me. That became my main issue with the game: playability. If you're an experienced PC gamer, I really do reccomend trying this game for yourself. First and forward, I have yet to beat the game yet, just begun- but this is my standpoint so far:

Overall, the game has a dark feel to it, definately a Germany-Nazi timing.  The music is very good for the ambiance and the graphics are outstanding.  The game is a little confusing at start, but once you get the hang of it, the game has me hooked.  There is a small learning curve to how to movement, but easy to catch on.

Pros: 1) Stunning music to go with this type of game.
2) Graphics are outstanding, even it's dark.
3) Movement is easy with a small learning curve.
4) Good storyline so far, excellent job.

Cons: 1) The graphics can be a bit choppy.
2) A little laggy at times, and confusing to where to go.
3) Save places are hard to find at times (might be just part of the game though).

For people who want a good game with a good storyline and re-learn gameplay, this is great.  For those who want a 'run 'n'gun' game, this is not the best for you unless you want to move to something different.  I love the game so far, and am really glad Greenlight gave it a go.  I hope that more people will give this game a try, the stunning work involved making it and it hard to step away, even you are just looking at the graphics in the game.  Way to go group- keep up the work!

-Fox


*Edit-
The zombies that come at you are more like cut & paste critters, and they are a lot faster than you could be.  The lack of ammo makes it very difficult to beat them, even with a -few- headshots to them.  I still like the idea, don't get me wrong.  Developers put a lot of work in the feel of the game, it just needs some refining.

-Fox
